item.name: buffers allocated
item.description: Количество выделенных буферов

item.name: buffers written directly by a backend
times a backend had to execute its own fsync
item.description: Сколько раз серверному процессу пришлось выполнить fsync самостоятельно (обычно фоновый процесс записи сам обрабатывает эти вызовы, даже когда серверный процесс выполняет запись самостоятельно)

item.name: buffers written during checkpoints
item.description: Количество буферов, записанных при выполнении контрольных точек

item.name: buffers written by the bgwriter
item.description: Количество буферов, записанных фоновым процессом записи

item.name: required checkpoints
item.description: Количество запрошенных контрольных точек, которые уже были выполнены.

trigger.name: PostgreSQL required checkpoints occurs too frequently: {ITEM.LASTVALUE} > {$PG_CHECKPOINTS_REQ_THRESHOLD}

item.name: checkpoints by timeout
item.description: Количество запланированных контрольных точек, которые уже были выполнены.

item.name: sync time
item.description: Общее время, которое было затрачено на этап обработки контрольной точки, в котором файлы синхронизируются с диском, в миллисекундах

item.name: write time
item.description: Общее время, которое было затрачено на этап обработки контрольной точки, в котором файлы записываются на диск, в миллисекундах.

item.name: maxwritten clean
item.description: Сколько раз фоновый процесс записи останавливал сброс грязных страниц на диск из-за того, что записал слишком много буферов

item.name: cache hit ratio
item.description: Check cache hit ratio in %.

trigger.name: PostgreSQL cache hit ratio too low: {ITEM.LASTVALUE} < {$PG_CACHE_HIT_RATIO}

item.name: number of active connections
item.description: Total count of active clients who connected to the PostgreSQL service and performing work.

item.name: number of idle connections
item.description: Total count of idle clients connected to the PostgreSQL service.

item.name: number of idle in transaction connections
item.description: Total count of idle clients who connected to the PostgreSQL service and have unfinished transaction. This client must be disconnected.

trigger.name: PostgreSQL idle in transaction connections too high: {ITEM.LASTVALUE} > {$PG_CONN_IDLE_IN_TRANSACTION}

item.name: number of prepared connections
item.description: Total count of clients connected to the PostgreSQL service and blocked by others clients.

item.name: total connections
item.description: Total count of clients connected to the PostgreSQL service.

item.name: total connections (%)
item.description: Connections percentage of the maximum number of allowed connections (max_connections).

trigger.name: PostgreSQL total number of connections too high: {ITEM.LASTVALUE} > {$PG_CONN_TOTAL_PCT}

item.name: number of waiting connections
item.description: Total count of clients connected to the PostgreSQL service and blocked by others clients.

item.name: blocks hit per second
item.description: Number of times disk blocks were found already in the buffer cache, so that a read was not necessary (this only includes hits in the PostgreSQL buffer cache, not the operating system's file system cache)

item.name: blocks read per second
item.description: Number of disk blocks read

item.name: registered deadlocks
item.description: Number of deadlocks detected.

item.name: temp_bytes written
item.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created, and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.

item.name: temp_files created
item.description: Number of temporary files created by queries. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why the temporary file was created (e.g., sorting or hashing), and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.

item.name: tuples deleted per second
item.description: Number of rows deleted by queries.

item.name: tuples inserted per second
item.description: Number of rows inserted by queries.

item.name: tuples returned per second
item.description: Number of rows returned by queries.

item.name: tuples updated per second
item.description: Number of rows updated by queries.

item.name: commits per second
item.description: Number of transactions that have been committed.

item.name: rollbacks per second
item.description: Number of transactions that have been rolled back.

item.name: autovacuum_freeze_max_age
item.description: https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.6/static/runtime-config-autovacuum.html#GUC-AUTOVACUUM-FREEZE-MAX-AGE

item.name: fsync
item.description: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.2/static/runtime-config-wal.html#GUC-FSYNC

item.name: full_page_writes
item.description: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.2/static/runtime-config-wal.html#GUC-FULL-PAGE-WRITES

item.name: synchronous_commit
item.description: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.2/static/runtime-config-wal.html#GUC-SYNCHRONOUS-COMMIT

item.name: stand-by count
item.description: Streaming replication stand-bys count.

item.name: recovery state
item.description: Streaming replication state: t (true) if service is in recovery mode, and f (false) if server in master mode.

trigger.name: PostgreSQL active transaction too long: time={ITEM.LASTVALUE} > {$PG_LONG_QUERY_THRESHOLD}

item.name: postgresql version
item.description: Connections percentage of the maximum number of allowed connections (max_connections).

item.name: WAL segments count
item.description: Number of WAL segments stored in pg_xlog directory.

item.name: WAL write
item.description: WAL write in bytes.

discovery_rule.name: PostgreSQL databases discovery
discovery_rule.params:
<parms type="p" prefix="pgsql."> <server> <discovery time="60" item="DB4bix.config[discovery,{$DSN}]" names="DATABASE">select datname as database from pg_database where not datistemplate and datallowconn and datname!='postgres'</discovery>
<query time="60" item="db.size[%1]">SELECT t1.datname AS dbname, pg_database_size(t1.datname) AS db_size FROM pg_database t1 where not datistemplate and t1.datname!='postgres' and datallowconn</query>
<query time="60" items="autovac_freeze_max_age.txns[%1]|autovac_freeze_max_age.txns_percent[%1]" type="column">SELECT datname, txns, ROUND(100*(txns/freez::FLOAT)) AS TXNS_PERCENT FROM (SELECT datname, foo.freez::int, age(datfrozenxid) AS txns FROM pg_database d JOIN (SELECT setting AS freez FROM pg_settings WHERE name = 'autovacuum_freeze_max_age') AS foo ON (TRUE) WHERE d.datallowconn AND not datistemplate and datname!='postgres' and datallowconn) AS foo2</query>
<query time="21600" item="setting[synchronous_commit]">select current_setting('synchronous_commit')</query> <query time="21600" item="setting[autovacuum_freeze_max_age]">select current_setting('autovacuum_freeze_max_age')</query> <query time="21600" item="setting[fsync]">select current_setting('fsync')</query> <query time="21600" item="setting[full_page_writes]">select current_setting('full_page_writes')</query>
<query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.blks_hit">select sum(blks_hit) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.blks_read">select sum(blks_read) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.xact_commit">select sum(xact_commit) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.conflicts">select sum(conflicts) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.deadlocks">select sum(deadlocks) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.xact_rollback">select sum(xact_rollback) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.temp_bytes">select sum(temp_bytes) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.temp_files">select sum(temp_files) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.tup_deleted">select sum(tup_deleted) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.tup_fetched">select sum(tup_fetched) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.tup_inserted">select sum(tup_inserted) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.tup_returned">select sum(tup_returned) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="120" item="dbstat.sum.tup_updated">select sum(tup_updated) from pg_stat_database</query>
<query time="600" item="bgwriter.buffers_alloc">select buffers_alloc from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.buffers_clean">select buffers_clean from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.buffers_backend">select buffers_backend from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.buffers_checkpoint">select buffers_checkpoint from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.checkpoints_timed">select checkpoints_timed from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.maxwritten_clean">select maxwritten_clean from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.checkpoints_req">select checkpoints_req from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.checkpoint_sync_time">select checkpoint_sync_time from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.buffers_backend_fsync">select buffers_backend_fsync from pg_stat_bgwriter</query> <query time="600" item="bgwriter.checkpoint_write_time">select checkpoint_write_time from pg_stat_bgwriter</query>
<query time="3600" item="cache.hit">select round(sum(blks_hit)*100/sum(blks_hit+blks_read), 2) from pg_stat_database</query> <query time="300" item="buffercache.clear">select count(*) from pg_buffercache where not isdirty</query> <query time="300" item="buffercache.dirty">select count(*) from pg_buffercache where isdirty</query> <query time="300" item="buffercache.total">select count(*) from pg_buffercache</query> <query time="300" item="buffercache.used">select count(*) from pg_buffercache where reldatabase is not null</query>
<query time="60" item="transactions.active">select coalesce(extract(epoch from max(age(now(), query_start))), 0) from pg_stat_activity where state <> 'idle in transaction' and state <> 'idle'</query> <query time="60" item="transactions.idle">select coalesce(extract(epoch from max(age(now(), query_start))), 0) from pg_stat_activity where state='idle in transaction'</query> <query time="60" item="transactions.prepared">select coalesce(extract(epoch from max(age(now(), prepared))), 0) from pg_prepared_xacts</query> <query time="60" item="transactions.waiting">select coalesce(extract(epoch from max(age(now(), query_start))), 0) from pg_stat_activity WHERE backend_type = 'client backend' AND state != 'idle' AND wait_event IS NOT NULL</query>
<query time="60" item="connections.active">select count(*) from pg_stat_activity where state = 'active'</query> <query time="60" item="connections.idle">select count(*) from pg_stat_activity where state = 'idle'</query> <query time="60" item="connections.idle_in_transaction">select count(*) from pg_stat_activity where state = 'idle in transaction'</query> <query time="60" item="connections.prepared">select count(*) from pg_prepared_xacts</query> <query time="60" item="connections.waiting">select count(*) from pg_stat_activity WHERE backend_type = 'client backend' AND state != 'idle' AND wait_event IS NOT NULL</query> <query time="60" item="connections.total">select count(*) from pg_stat_activity</query> <query time="60" item="connections.total_pct">select count(*)*100/(select current_setting('max_connections')::int) from pg_stat_activity</query>
<query time="60" item="pgstatstatements.avg_query_time">select round((sum(total_time) / sum(calls))::numeric,2) from pg_stat_statements</query>
<query time="3600" item="version">SELECT version() AS pg_version</query> <query time="60" item="uptime">select date_part('epoch', now() - pg_postmaster_start_time())::int</query>
<query time="3600" item="streaming.state">select pg_is_in_recovery()</query> <query time="120" item="streaming.count">select count(*) from pg_stat_replication</query>
<query time="120" item="wal.count">select count(*) from pg_ls_dir('pg_wal')</query> <query time="120" item="wal.write">select pg_wal_lsn_diff(pg_current_wal_lsn(),'0/00000000')</query>
</server> </parms>
discovery_rule.description: PostgreSQL database discovery. Use regular expressions to configure search.

discovery_rule.name: PostgreSQL streaming stand-by discovery
discovery_rule.params:
<parms type="p" prefix="pgsql."> <server> <discovery time="60" item="DB4bix.config[streaming,{$DSN}]" names="HOTSTANDBY">select application_name from pg_stat_replication</discovery>
<query time="60" item="streaming.lag.bytes[%1]">select application_name, greatest(0,pg_wal_lsn_diff(pg_current_wal_lsn(), replay_lsn)) from pg_stat_replication</query> <query time="60" item="streaming.lag.seconds[%1] nodata=0">SELECT application_name, EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM replay_lag)::INTEGER FROM pg_stat_replication</query>
</server> </parms>
discovery_rule.description: Low level discovery for streaming replication servers which connected to this server.

trigger_prototype.name: PostgreSQL streaming lag between {HOSTNAME} and {#HOTSTANDBY} to high ({ITEM.LASTVALUE})

item_prototype.name: streaming lag with {#HOTSTANDBY} in seconds
item_prototype.description: ATTENTION: This check requires access to the remote server postgresql service, respectively, should be determined access in pg_hba.conf on remote server. Example: host zabbix postgres 1.2.3.4/32 trust

trigger_prototype.name: PostgreSQL streaming lag between {HOSTNAME} and {#HOTSTANDBY} to high ({ITEM.LASTVALUE})

resource.name: PostgreSQL summary db stats: block hit/read
PostgreSQL summary db stats: temp files

graph.name: PostgreSQL summary db stats: block hit/read
PostgreSQL summary db stats: temp files
